reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Strengthening Tuberculosis control in the Republic of Moldova

description.narrative: Moldova - Tuberculosis - Center for Health Policies and Studies - PAS Center. This program has the following goals: To reduce the burden of tuberculosis (including M/XDR-TB) in Moldova by ensuring universal access to quality diagnosis and treatment, implementing sustainable patient-centered approaches, addressing the needs of high-risk groups and strengthening NTP management. The objectives of this program are: To ensure universal access to timely and quality diagnosis of all forms of TB inclusing MDR/XDR TB. To strenghten patient-centered approaches to MDR/XDR treatment. To improve management of HIV-associated TB

title.narrative: Number of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed TB, new and relapses
MDR TB-other 1 : Number and percentage of new MDR-TB patients transferred to or initiated DOTS Plus treatment on ambulatory phase and provided with incentives to improve treatment compliance
Percentage of new and relapse TB patients tested using WHO recommended rapid tests at the time of diagnosis
Percentage of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB started on treatment for MDR-TB who were lost to follow up during the first six months of treatment

MDR TB-other 2 : Number and percentage of new sensitive TB patients transferred to or initiated DOTS treatment on ambulatory level, provided with incentives to improve treatment compliance (Transnistria)
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
MDR TB-other 4 : Percentage of new and relapse TB patients tested using WHO recomennded rapid tests at the time of diagnosis
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
TB I-Other 1: MDR TB prevalence among previously treated TB patients
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
